document_title: Right-sided migraine: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_name: dau-nua-dau-ben-phai.json_8_Frequently asked questions about right-sided migraine symptoms
subsection_content:
How long can a right-sided migraine last?
Headaches of any location can last for several hours to several days, including right-sided migraines. At this time, the patient will feel constant dull pain, causing inconvenience in activities and life.
In some cases, you may experience a transient right-sided migraine, a sudden throbbing feeling and end very quickly, in just a few minutes.
Can migraines be cured?
Depending on the cause of the migraine, doctors will have different treatments. In case the right-sided migraine is chronic pain, the doctor may prescribe medication to temporarily end the pain as well as prevent the pain from recurring continuously.
In other cases such as migraines caused by food, living environment, stress, etc., influencing these factors can end right-sided migraines. In the case of right-sided migraine due to illness, treatment of the related disease will help you no longer suffer from unpleasant pain.
What is the best medicine for right-sided migraine?
If you have a mild right-sided migraine, you can use over-the-counter pain relievers such as paracetamol and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) such as ibuprofen, naproxen or aspirin, etc.
In addition, the doctor may prescribe the patient to use specific medications such as ergotamine tartrate, dihydroergotamine.
For people with chronic right migraine, after examination, the doctor may prescribe some preventive medications to limit pain, such as propranolol, nadolol, atenolol, etc.
However, arbitrarily taking medication and overusing it can increase the severity of migraines as well as lead to other side effects. Therefore, before using any pain reliever, you should see a doctor for advice and advice.
You should only take migraine medication as directed by your doctor
Is right-sided migraine dangerous?
Have. Migraines caused by trauma, stroke symptoms or diseases such as cerebral anemia, brain tumors, etc. are extremely dangerous if not treated promptly. In particular, migraines can lead to permanent brain damage. Therefore, you should not be subjective when you have signs of a right migraine.
Can migraines lead to death?
Currently, there is not enough scientific research to prove that right-sided migraine can lead to death. However, migraines can increase the risk of stroke by about 50%, doubling the risk of heart disease due to reduced blood flow leading to death.
Right-sided migraine is considered a particularly dangerous symptom. When suffering from migraines, patients should visit large, reputable hospitals for a health check. After examining the patient's medical history and living habits, doctors may prescribe head X-rays, CT scans, MRI scans, etc. to accurately check the cause of the disease.
Then, depending on the cause and condition, the doctor may prescribe the patient to be hospitalized for observation or take medication at home.

Right-sided migraines can negatively impact quality of life, causing mental health effects or sleep problems. Not only that, this can also be a warning sign of serious neurological disease or damage. Therefore, if you suspect you have right-sided migraines, right-sided headaches, or frequent right-sided migraines, take the initiative to go to the hospital for examination and do not self-medicate at home to avoid dangerous complications. can happen.
